duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage teams responsible for developing and delivering IT solutions for the business and customers.
Leads and mentors staff responsible for hardware and/or software planning, vendor selection, acquisition, problem resolution, set-up integration, testing and installation.
Contributes to the development of annual technology solution plans and assesses customer requirements.
Responsible for all aspects of budget for supported products and services and influences the development of standards and decisions regarding changes to systems/applications.
Manages all aspects of systems analysis, design, development, installation, maintenance, and enhancement for mission-critical application systems.
Develop project resourcing strategies, allocating budget, staff, tools, and specialized support necessary for cost-effective implementation and training.
Responsible for vendor management and contract negotiation of supported products and services.
Participates on advisory level counsels to drive strategy and roadmap for supported product and services.
Organizes and coordinates the activities associated with installation, deployment and upgrade of software, hardware and network facilities.
Manages the technical interface to the business unit/customers, to include RFQ specification review, hand-son testing and modeling and interfacing with development for systems design.
Builds and maintains good relationships with customers and ensures technology solutions are compliant with architectural standards and established methodologies and practices.
Manages the day-to-day activities of the assigned area, including leadership, direction, and growth opportunities to department members.
Manages the development and delivery of training for internal IT and external users.
Observes all policies, procedures, laws, regulations, and risk limits and raises and reports known or suspected violations to the appropriate authority.
Performs other related duties as required.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field (Master's preferred)
